newsitem.title: USA: AirTouch says Cox retires as vice chairman. [CORRECTED 00:40 GMT 13/12]
newsitem.headline: AirTouch says Cox retires as vice chairman. [CORRECTED 00:40 GMT 13/12]

text.p: (Corrects headline and first paragraph to make clear Lee Cox is retiring rather than resigning.)
AirTouch Communications Inc said Lee Cox will retire as vice chairman for domestic operations and president and chief executive officer of AirTouch Cellular, effective April 4, 1997.
Brian Jones, a 12-year Airtouch veteran, will replace Cox as President of AirTouch Cellular.

AirTouch promoted Arun Sarin, currently President and chief executive officer of AirTouch International, to president and chief operating officer of AirTouch Communications. Sarin will also assume Cox's role as chairman of the board of PrimeCo Personal Communications, the company's PCS venture.
